summary:
USB is a common way to connect electronic devices and transfer data. It was created in 1996 to simplify how computers and peripherals like keyboards and mice connect. USB has evolved to replace many different ports and is now used for charging phones and other devices.

The latest type, USB-C, can handle lots of power and data, up to 240 watts and 80 gigabits per second. USB has different versions (1.x, 2.0, 3.x, and USB4), each with faster data transfer speeds. USB is now the standard for charging many mobile devices, making it more convenient.
title: USB
